title: [BUG] Example project sklearn_elasticnet_wine is not compliant with databricks guide for remote execution
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: Binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.3.0
- **Python version**: 3.6
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
The databricks guide to [Reproducible Runs with MLflow Projects
](https://docs.databricks.com/applications/mlflow/projects.html) uses the sklearn_elasticnet_wine example project from MLflow. However, following the guide leads to the following error when doing remote execution:
`2019/10/29 08:24:30 ERROR mlflow.cli: === No value given for missing parameters: 'alpha' ===`

### Code to reproduce issue
Following the steps outlined under "Example" in the guide produces the error.

### Other info / logs
Proposed solution: Add a default value to the parameter alpha in the MLproject file
